Event: Traces of Your Predecessors
Ice Age

According to your scientists, this icy planet holds a secret: it was once a planet-sized factory owned by the Endless, the first spacefaring people to harness the power of Dust. The Endless are extinct now, but if they left any traces of their civilization behind, they'd be frozen miles under the surface.
Perhaps their archaeological remains may still hold valuable lessons for you and your empire. But how will you dig through all that ice?
Terraform the Frozen Planet
Terraform the planet $QuestPlanetName into a Temperate planet.
Unlock terraformation technologies from the Science and Exploration quadrant of the Tech Tree.
This Quest has failed

Despite all your efforts, not much of the Endless civilization remains here: it seems a long succession of sentient species inhabited this planet in the eons after the Endless's demise. Traces of the Endless have been all but wiped out. It wasn't a complete waste of time, however. You managed to unearth a set of ancient ship technology blueprints that seem to perform very efficiently, even by modern standards.
Foreign Contaminant

One of your exploratory drones, used by your team for rapid planetary assessment, has disappeared. According to your lead technician, this type of drone has a particularly low malfunction rate. He thinks it was intentionally sent off course by someone... or something. The drone has a cargo bay for collecting samples. Perhaps if you find it, you might discover what happened to it.
Two sites look like promising leads. They're both in difficult locations though, and recovery will be expensive--and possibly dangerous.
Explore the Quest Curiosities on the planet $QuestPlanetName. Each expedition will cost $Amount01Name [Strat01titaniumColored] #3C98FF#Titanium#REVERT#.
If you've used up all your probes, you will need to wait for a cooldown period for replenishment.

A strange sight greets the expedition team at the second site. The drone is partially sunk in swampland, close to another abandoned vessel. From the tangled growths ensnaring the vessel, it's clear it's been here a long time. You find no sign of any crew, but do manage to reactivate the craft. It'll make a useful addition to your fleets.
This Quest has failed
Pirate Ship spawned on System $QuestSystem01Name
Vital Statistics

The Galactic Census is coming up, and although you have greater worries on your mind, you remember what one of your wisest advisors once said: that a great leader is often judged not by his actions, but by the statistics he leaves behind. Perhaps it is worth investing a bit of effort to leave your mark on history--as the databases will remember it.
Parade
Building a military armada stronger than anything seen before will ensure your name is writ large in the history books.
In less than $Timer [turn] Turns, possess $Amount06Name Ships of at least $Amount03Name [offensiveMilitaryPower] offensive power.
Add Attack Modules to Ships to increase their Offensive Power.
The military parade wows the crowds, and the statisticians confirm that such a powerful fleet is unprecedented. You will be remembered as a great defender of your people.
Build
An era of unfettered construction will see the skylines of your biggest cities transformed, and your legacy secured.
In less than $Timer [turn] turns, generate $Amount04Name [industryColored] in one of your Systems.
Build Industry-generating constructions, and bring in Industry-focused Populations to the System.
Your system has become a beacon of industrial might, ready to construct whatever your empire needs. No leader has built a stronger base, and your name will be forever synonomous with strength.
Hoard
Economic might, more than any other program, will secure your legacy. Amass a Dust fortune that will never be forgotten.
In less than $Timer [turn] turns, stockpile $Amount05Name [dustColored] in your Empire.
Build Dust-generating constructions, create Trading Companies, and lower spending to bolster Dust reserves.
The Empire Treasury overflows with Dust, the wealth enough to make many dreams reality. Your stats are the envy of the galaxy.
This Quest has failed
The Lost Expedition

The expedition made landfall days ago, but nothing has been heard since they entered a region of mild seismic activity on the second day. Electromagnetic analysis of the region suggests that their communication equipment should still be functional, so lack of contact is unlikely to have a technical cause. What should you do? Stay loyal to the missing team and send another party down to investigate? Or keep everyone aboard, and not expose them to unknown risks? You have a bad feeling about this . . .
Rescue

You owe the expedition team your loyalty--after all, who will serve you in future if they think you will abandon them at the first sign of danger? Your scientific counsel, however, has advised you that the action is not without risk. They estimate a 20% chance of the entire Fleet undertaking the search being lost.
Search the Curiosity on the planet $QuestPlanetName if you're ready to sacrifice $Amount01Name [Strat02hyperiumColored] #EAD085#hyperium#REVERT#… and maybe your Fleet.
A rescue party will cost [Strat02hyperiumColored] #EAD085#hyperium#REVERT# and may result in the loss of the entire Fleet.
The rescue party touches down on the planet, close to the site of the last known contact . . .
Protect

Only a fool would repeat the same action, and expect a different result. Without more information, mounting a rescue expedition would only jeopardise the lives of more of your people. It's an unpalatable truth, but sometimes exploring alien worlds is dangerous. The best you can do is honor the memories of those who were lost.
Rename the $MyColonizedSystemLocationName System to honor the lost.
If this System is lost before you change its name, you'll fail the quest. To rename a System, go in it management view and click on the existing name and write a new one.
Here stands $MyColonizedSystemLocationName, dedicated to the heroism of the fallen explorers.
This quest has failed
Unknown consequences...
A Million Things I Haven't Done (Part 3)

The day after the duel, the headlines are filled with the outrage of the people. In a contest held on one of your Empire's outer worlds, the opportunist, once one of your staunchest advisors, shot and killed the young upstart who thwarted him at every turn.
The witness accounts are frustratingly unreliable. Allies for the young man claim he aimed his gun away from the opportunist, not willing to kill his old friend, but the older man's friends bitterly mock those who claim this—how many times did the upstart say he would "not throw away his shot?"
Nevertheless, there is no public support for the upstart's murderer. He flees your Empire, and intelligence reports have surfaced of him building a rebel army somewhere out among the stars...
Bitter Fruit
Occasionally one takes risks that turn out poorly. Even the usually supportive media outlets are critical, and your ratings drop,
A Million Things I Haven't Done (Part 3)

The two combatants meet on a neutral ship in a neutral system. Their lieutentants stand ready. A physician, present as merely a formality, turns her back. The two men raise their guns, say a prayer for their families---and fire!
They miss.
The witnesses brace themselves for another round but neither men can seem to find the energy to reload. There's a pause, until the upstart says "I think this has gone a little too far."
They depart, and soon the story of the duel makes headlines everywhere. The rollicking tale of insults, betrayal, and forgiveness ignites a fire in your people, and soon the two men are lionized as heroes for walking away from the battle.
Narrow Escape
You should feel lucky that things turned out this way. You have not lost their talents nor your popular support, though the population begins to frown on such acts of violence.
Increases [pacifistColored] (Pacifist) political ideology (10 [turn] )
The Lost Expedition - Resurrection

Success! On the fifth day, the rescue party picked up a weak signal coming from a system of caves within the region that the original team disappeared. Upon investigation, they discovered the team surviving inside a Vodyani craft near the mouth of the caves. Although the crew gave conflicting accounts of what had happened, and possessed equipment that was prematurely aged, they were found to be in fine physical and mental health. After some simple repairs to the Vodyani craft, both the rescue party and the missing crew were able to leave the surface and return to the fleet. Insights gleaned from the whole affair have triggered a scientific renaissance across the empire.
Rescued!

The rescue mission is a success, bringing home not only the missing team, but also a Vodyani vessel. Questions remain as to exactly what happened, but the upshot is that interest in science has never been greater!
Increases [scientistColored] (Scientist) political ideology Spawns Vodyani ship on $QuestSystem01Name System.
The Lost Expedition - Disaster

Grim tidings. It seems your scientific counsel wasn't wrong to warn you that the entire fleet might be in danger should you undertake a rescue mission. Now they're gone, their only visible remains a thin trail of smoke from a mountainous region on the planet. How? Questions remain, but something malicious got into the fleet's navigation computers when the rescue party sent a tight-beam update on the third day. They'd been relaying information about tracking a faint signal from the area in which the original team disappeared, when everything went dark across the entire fleet. Then the fleet's engines fired up full-blast, setting course for the planet. They must've tried to wrest control back, but they weren't successful. Every ship hurtled into the mountainside at hundreds of klicks per second. Nobody would've survived. Unsurprisingly, superstitious thinking across the empire is on the up.
Calamity
Events of the ground involving the rescue team, somehow precipitated the loss of the entire fleet. The news has increased religious fervor across the empire.
Increases [religiousColored] (Religious) political ideology A fleet is destroyed.
A Cold Homecoming

You have found Auriga, the place from which your people departed ages ago. There seems to be no sign of life; the fate of those you left behind will require further investigation. Regardless, there is some cold satisfaction in knowing that the desperate escape from a dying planet was ultimately a success.
Melancholy
While your scientists learn much, your people mourn their lifeless home.
Traces of Ancestors

The act of colonization gives you the time and resources necessary to thoroughly explore the planet. Ancient galleries and halls are discovered, linked to great cave systems and mines far below the surface. Though it speaks to you of the genius and strength of your people, you find no evidence that they survived. Nor, however, do you find evidence that they died and were buried here...
Bereavement
Omnipotence
After a period of havoc and turmoil, your alliance has come to dominate the galaxy. Tribute, trade, and primordial Dust rain down upon you.
Blessings
The wealth of nations repays your strategic decisions and your good fortune.
Dominance
After a period of havoc and turmoil, your alliance has come to dominate the galaxy. Uncovered knowledge and shared experience give a great boost to your Heroes.
Acceleration
The powers of the Academy propogate among your remaining heroes.
+4 levels on Heroes
Ships orbiting arround Lodestones restored
Ships orbiting arround Lodestones destroyed
Description
Galactic Effects
Academy Quest Conclusion

The visionary--or insane--plans of Isyander Shumèd have come to fruition, and the power of his Academy grows. The beings called the Lost will gradually return, though not even Isyander knows how the galaxy will evolve as they regain their strength. All that can be said for sure is that the old gods have been resurrected, and we must hope that they are benevolent.
Heroes can only be recruited from the Academy, not from the Marketplace Isyander's opponents ([scientist] team) can no longer recruit Heroes + 1 [dustColored] per ship orbiting arround Lodestones
Academy Quest Conclusion

The mad--or visionary--plans of Isyander Shumèd have been brought crashing down, and his Academy has been destroyed. The Lost will not return; the future of the galaxy is a story that will be written by lesser species. For better or for worse, the old gods are gone and the sentient peoples of this multiverse stride forward, alone.
Heroes can only be recruited from the Marketplace, not from the Academy Isyander's allies ([religious] team) can no longer recruit Heroes + 2 [manPower] per ship orbiting arround Lodestones
Bilgeli Plating
Hellraiser Torpedoes
Tiryak Drive
Deployable Ramparts
Impregnable Shielding
Annhilator Beam
Heroic Hull
NAL Module

Weapon fires once every phase
Weapon ignores Shields and Hull Plating
Anti-fighter kinetic weapon system
This module cannot be fitted on Heavy Mounts.
This module can only be fitted on Heavy Mounts.
Eternal Bulwark
Sonic Disruption Net

Powerful soundwaves transmitted across the system have two distinct, and beneficial, effects. Firstly, unbeknownst to the local population, the soundwaves are a subversive recruitment tool, encouraging greatly increased military sign-up rates. Secondly, and overtly, the transmissions are attuned to enemy forces' physiologies, reducing their health in the eventuality of attack.
Magnate's Council

Assembling the best and brightest of your industrial gurus from around the empire is no easy task, but the construction of this Magnate's Council will do the trick. Prestige for the gurus, and for the lucky system where the Council is seated, elevated industrial output on account of their brilliant insights. Especially when the population is content. Just don't say the word "nepotism".
Citizen's Entrepreneurium

A vast forum, physically manifested as an enormous complex of public spaces, galleries, meeting rooms, bars, and atriums in the system's capital, but in reality more significant in its cyber-spatial guise. For it is in these spaces that every entrepreneur, no matter how big or small, may share--and glean--hard-won business wisdom. Trade income and population influence rocket.
Ultra-wealth Sanctuary

It might not be the fairest or most redistributive project, but encouraging the super-rich to harbor their assets in-system can have amazing effects on trade income (not to mention a juicy boost to luxuries). Just try not to pay too much attention to who's reaping the benefits of this economic bonanza.
Lodestone Link

While battles rage for control of the ancient sites of the Lost, centers can be built in your systems that not only replicate the information discovered from the Lodestones, but also link with them. Stores of Dust, rich in power and data, can be exploited to improve system production.
Deep Space Personnel Systems
Distributed Fusion

One way to minimize disruption to complex civilian and military systems is to distribute power generation. Miniaturized fusion generators permit individual systems to have their own power sources, reducing their vulnerability to a general system failure.
Cryogenic Colonizer
The role of this ship is to cover great distances and create new colonies in distant star systems.
Augmented Sensors
+5 Vision Range on Ship
Single-Use Stardrive
+10 [move] on Ship
Battlestation
This ultimate upgrade to the standard carrier model is designed to hold additional Manpower. If required, it can be a mobile invasion platform.
Accelerated Armaments
Increased energy delivery to weapons modules adds critical damage capacity to all ship hulls.
Citadel of Demography

A learned institution, where experts in the disciplines of xenology, social psychology and big data can come together to identify the critical individuals who are shaping public opinion across the empire. In this way, new and existing laws require less support to be implemented or maintained.
Information Blackops

This intelligence agency has one express purpose: to retrieve incriminating or compromising information on foreign diplomats which can be used as leverage in negotiations. Monitoring the full spectrum of diplomats' activities and communications by using field operatives working across the galaxy, the empire enjoys less costly diplomatic exchanges.
Federated Procurement Office

While massive bureaucracies are not generally thought of as efficient, in this case a highly automated center ships necessary materials, parts and labor in response to battle reports and sensor readings rather than waiting for requests. Ship refit and repair time increases dramatically, and public servants are appreciated.
-25% on [dustColored] and Strategics Retrofit
Micro-expression Manipulation

It's long been known that intelligent life always betrays its true intentions through fleeting expressions--usually facial, but sometimes otherwise depending on the alien in question--that a skilled reader can discern. With this technology rolled out across the empire, diplomats can not only get a better read on their opponents, but also disrupt their own emotional giveaways.
Spinoff Incubator

Many scientists care little for the commercial opportunities inherent in their research, but with this dedicated team tasked with monetizing scientific insights, great or small, the empire can enjoy increased wealth creation.
Clear Skies Program

Great thinkers don't always make the best communicators, but under the guidance of the Clear Skies Program, scientists from across the empire can improve their PR skills. As a result, scientific institutions wield increasing levels of influence in society.
Terraforming Megasite

This massive real-time center of atmospheric, chemical, and geological knowledge helps coordinate scientific advances that pertain to terraforming across the empire. Terraforming technologies, projects, and tools benefit from a radically increased level of efficiency.
Simultaneous War System
A centralized communication system, coupled with fleet commanders across your empire, permits the rapid planning and visualization of maneuvers and an increase in the capacity to manage fleets.
Glia Lak.Admstr7B2

In a eusocial species like the Amoeba, where the large-scale direction of the race is dictated by the whims and desires of millions of shifting, overlapping minds, the ability for an individual to organise the collective and impose a unified outlook is essential. Without such order, the Amoeba would in all likelihood pull in a thousand different directions and go precisely nowhere. This then, was Glia Lak.Admstr7B2's great gift to its species--the ability to shape group gestalts into purposeful units. When this skill came to the attention of Isyander, the leader of the Academy, Glia was invited to share her wisdom in exchange for Dust-enhancement. Always thirsting for knowledge, Glia accepted. At the Academy, Glia did indeed become even more able, but found the organisation's methods at odds with its own pacifist outlook and elected to leave. Estranged from the Amoeba, today Glia scours the galaxy for other opportunities to learn.
Hunker Bunkers
Resource Scanning
Profiting from the unusual characteristics of Resources, a maxiumum of effort is made to better understand their nature and draw scientific conclusions.
Home Sweet Home

Diplomatic options
Refused Diplomatic demand
$OtherEmpire reacted to your response
$OtherEmpire responded to your demand
$OtherEmpire wants trespassers out
You must immediately remove the fleets trespassing in our territory.
The outdated fleet you sent our way? We don't collect antiques. Get it out, now!
Remove fleets from sphere of Influence
This empire has fleets inside your Influence zone. Sending this term will ask them to remove them.
Accept
Sometimes to move forward one has to go backwards…
Refuse
The fleets are just passing through...
$OtherEmpire agreed to remove their fleets
We agree to remove our fleets as a gesture of goodwill.
We agree to remove our fleets as a gesture of goodwill.
This singularity was not intended to do harm. If it bothers you, we'll remove it.
Others are more appreciative of the benefits of our Tendrils; we shall direct them elsewhere.
We apologize if our culture has been overwhelming your citizens. We will try to appear less impressive in the future.
This was an unfortunate accident and we agree to cancel any further hostile actions on your forces.
We will remove our Outposts in a gesture of goodwill.
Perhaps a few captains were over-zealous--or famished. We will tell them to stop.
Acknowledge
This was an efficient, pragmatic exchange. Maybe we can improve relations with them.
Ridicule
They accepted very easily. Did we scare them?
$OtherEmpire refused to remove their fleets
Sorry if our fleets bother you, but they aren't turning around.
Denounce
You asked nicely, and they refused. They cannot be trusted and everyone should know.
Cover-up
This was not our finest moment. Let's downplay the issue. Discreetly...
Good deeds should not go unnoticed. We thank you for your cooperation.
Really? A simple request and you run away? How cute!
Everyone will know about your bullying and saber-rattling...
Our anger has faded; we relent.
$OtherEmpire wants your Outposts removed
Please remove your Outposts bordering our territory. We see this as an act of aggression.
Remove nearby Outposts
This empire has set up an Outpost directly next to your empire. Sending this term will ask them to remove all of their Outposts next to your empire.
$OtherEmpire insists that you remove your Arks from their territory.
Please remove your Arks bordering our territory. We see them as an act of aggression.
Remove nearby Arks
This empire has docked an Ark directly next to your empire. Sending this term will ask them to remove their Arks that are next to your empire.
Accept
It's not that nice a neighborhood anyway.
Refuse
We need more space to feed our people and supply our industries.
$OtherEmpire agreed to remove their Outposts
We will remove our Outposts in a gesture of goodwill.
Commend
They did what we asked without getting annoyed about it.
Expand
Now that the system is available, it's time to redouble our colonization efforts.
$OtherEmpire refused to remove their Outposts
We didn't come here to start a fight, but we aren't leaving. We need this system.
Condemn
A nation's territory is sacred, and no one should feel pressured inside their own borders. This hostile behaviour is unacceptable!
Press
They may be stubborn, but that gives us another opportunity.
Your prompt and peaceful actions should be a model for all empires to follow.
Thank you for evacuating this part of our territory. Like you, we also need space to grow.
How would you feel if you woke up with someone sleeping in your home? This is not acceptable!
Our diplomats and businesses will not be pleased with your stubbornness. Things may get uncomfortable for you.
$OtherEmpire wants attacks to stop
You must stop these unwarranted attacks on our fleets!
Halt attacks
This empire has attacked one of your fleets. Sending this term will ask them to cancel any further attacks on your forces for a set period of time.
Accept
Cold war does have "war" in the name, but it needn't become one.
Refuse
This attack was justified by our sovereign defense needs. As are any--hypothetical--following ones.
$OtherEmpire agreed to stop attacks
This was an unfortunate accident and we agree to cancel any further hostile actions on your forces.
Acknowledge
They were in the wrong, but they did what's right and we should recognize this fact.
Ignore
It's the least they could do! And they better not try it again...
$OtherEmpire refused to stop attacks
Your fleet was a problem, and we see many more "problems" on the map.
Prepare
This was to be expected. Ready all fleets for continued hostilities.
Mobilize
Ready our defenses; we don't trust them and don't know what they'll do next.
Your efforts to act in good faith are appreciated. We hope this sort of incident doesn't repeat itself.
We see no reason to be particularly thankful that you did what was obviously right.
We do not trust you, and our fleets have been placed on high alert.
We can only assume that your intentions are hostile, and we will build our defenses accordingly.
$OtherEmpire wants pacific conversion to stop
You must immediately stop the conversion of our systems, even if you do see it as "peaceful".
Stop pacific conversion
This empire is currently converting one or more of your systems. Sending this term will ask them to stop and cancel any further conversions for a set period of time.
Accept
Our culture is superior, but their government doesn't see it even if their citizens do! Still, we can ease up on the long-range wide-scale broadcasts.
Refuse
It's not our fault if we are culturally and intellectually superior.
$OtherEmpire agreed to stop converting
We apologize if our culture has been overwhelming your citizens. We will try to appear less impressive in the future.
Commend
Maybe they are as nice as they pretend to be; if so, we should extend an olive branch.
Press
A lull in their propaganda means that we can start broadcasting our own ideas...
$OtherEmpire refused to stop converting
Culture is an idea, not something tangible. How do you expect us to suddenly stop being amazing?
Expose
The galaxy should know that while not militarist, this empire certainly is aggressive!
Invest
Perhaps we have been lacking in the education of our own citizens. It's time to let them know how lucky they are!
We thank you for your wise and harmonious decision. Perhaps we should speak more regularly, so this incident doesn't repeat itself?
We have seen the effects of your influential culture, and think it is time for us to more widely broadcast our own successes.
This particular policy smells of outright conquest! Other empires will be warned about your aggression.
We see that we have not taken enough care to properly educate our own citizens, and will immediately take steps to amend this.
$OtherEmpire wants Essence harvesting to stop
You must immediately stop your Essence leeching in our systems, even if you do see it as "just having a snack".
Stop Harvesting Essence
This empire is currently using Leecher modules to abduct your population. Sending this term will ask them to stop and cancel any further leeching actions for a set period of time.
Accept
Let's not annoy them any more; we can probably feed elsewhere.
Refuse
We will not starve just to make them happy; the Essence will be harvested.
$OtherEmpire agreed to stop leeching
Perhaps a few captains were over-zealous--or famished. We will tell them to stop.
Recover
Now that the pressure is off, we should encourage people to repopulate the affected system.
Ridicule
Not a very serious atttiude! I wouldn't let my people go hungry so easily.
$OtherEmpire refused to stop leeching
It is necessary to our survival; we cannot and will not stop.
Denounce
They dare to ignore us and feed on our citizens? We'll bring them down a notch in the galactic standings...
Study
Well, if we can't stop it, we might as well study the phenomenon and learn something...
We thank you for your rapid and righteous response. We will see that the lost population is renewed.
That was easy! I guess you don't mind letting your people starve.
Sentient beings are not your victuals! Other empires will hear of your disgusting gluttony.
Your refusal shows an utter lack of ethics and morality. We will watch closely and learn how to not become like you.
$OtherEmpire wants your singularity gone
You must immediately stop your time manipulations in our systems; it is an unwanted and unnatural act.
Remove Singularities
This empire has placed Singularities on one or more of your systems. Sending this term will ask them to remove them and cancel any further singularity placement for a set period of time.
Accept
Not everyone understands the beauty and power of time manipulation.
Refuse
Don't they appreciate the awe and mastery of a Singularity? Maybe they will if it stays.
$OtherEmpire agreed to remove their singularities
This singularity was not intended to do harm. If it bothers you, we'll remove it.
Recover
With time back to normal, we can focus on growth.
Ridicule
That was a speedy capitulation for people who can manipulate time!
$OtherEmpire kept their Singularities
Time and its mysteries are greater than your small-minded worries. The Singularity will stay.
Denounce
If they do this to us, they'll do it to anyone. Let's make sure other empires understand how irresponsible these beings are.
Conduct Experiments
This is certainly an opportunity to do some research. Now, how to explain that to the population…
We appreciate your understanding; we prefer to leave time alone and instead accelerate growth.
That was fast! It seems that manipulating time just makes you quicker to surrender.
You play with dangerous powers, and every other empire will know this and think less of you.
We will take advantage of your rudeness, and get every bit of scientific data we can from your continued intrusion.
$OtherEmpire wants your Tendrils gone
You must remove your Tendrils from our systems at once; we do not wish to be part of your galactic gardening obsession.
Remove Tendrils
This empire has placed tendrils on at least one of your systems. Sending this term will ask them to remove them and cancel any further Entwining for a set period of time.
Accept
It seems they can't comprehend the beauty of our network; we can expand it elsewhere.
Refuse
It's beneficial for everyone; we see no reason to remove the Tendrils.
$OtherEmpire agreed to stop Entwining
Others are more appreciative of the benefits of our Tendrils; we shall direct them elsewhere.
Salvage
It is an interesting phenomenon... Let's send some teams there and learn what we can from it!
Ridicule
The first sign of rain and the Leafheads run for cover!
$OtherEmpire refused to remove Tendrils
Clearly, you cannot see the forest for the trees. The Tendrils are beneficial to all, and will stay.
Denounce
The whole galaxy should know that these trees are trying to snare us in a giant web!
Study
As long as the vile things are here, we might as well study them.
We thank you for your peaceful solution to this, and hope you don't mind if we observe this fascinating ability you have.
Who would have guessed that removing weeds was so easy?
It's like waking up with someone's hands on your throat. We'll warn the other empires that they may be next!
If we're going to be stuck with all this extra vegetable matter, perhaps we can learn how to consume it...

You seen the latest episode of that new reality show, Home Invader? Lumeris girl breaks into a Vodyani temple. Vodyani finds her, threatens to harvest her Essence if she doesn't get out. That's kinda where we are.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . ANGRY: Get out of Craver territory.
You trespass upon sacred space, and the Church of Virtual Saints insists that you leave.
We thank you to trade outside our borders. Internal commerce is for us.
We prefer to keep our territory, like our forests, pristine and free of outside interference. Leave, or suffer.
You tread on very thin ice. Withdraw your fleets from Empire territory immediately. Failure to comply will result in severe consequences.
You are not up to our standards of personal hygiene; please leave Horatio territory.
Do not think you can trespass so flagrantly without repercussions. You should know your enemy better before making such choices. Remove yourselves.
$OtherEmpire has sent a demand
You can lower the pressure on your empire with this small favor
Diplomatic demand (basic)
Use accumulated pressure to demand resources from the other empire (or impose basic penalties)
Diplomatic demand (advanced)
Use accumulated pressure to demand advanced favors from the other empire (or impose harsh penalties)
Accept
Accept their terms
We concede to your demand
Refuse
Decline their offer
We will not comply with your demand
Free Resource term
The other empire will be able to choose between accepting the selected term, or suffering the selected penalty
Free Advanced or Third-party term
This additional term may involve other empires (forced alliance departure, declare war on a third party, or cancel an existing agreement)
Refusal penalty
If the other empire declines the terms, you can apply this effect.
Co-operative protocol
Both you and the other empire will gain an incremental boost depending on each others' main population. The longer the Co-operative protocol lasts, the better the boost.
Cancel Co-operative protocol
This is a unilateral declaration to stop a Co-operative protocol with an other empire.
Denounce Alliance
Denounce the war declared by your alliance. You will leave your alliance and be at Cold War with your ex-alliance members and the factions involved in the war declaration.
What do you think of a co-operative protocol?
It's a deal!
Forget it. Looks boring.
Agree to a co-operative protocol.
The Hive does not like this.
The Hive accepts.
Shall we sign a holy co-operative protocol?
It is in the interest of the Church; we agree.
This does not serve our holy purpose.
What do you say to a special co-operative protocol deal?
That's an offer we can't refuse.
This is not in the interests of the Four Families.
Would you bind with the Heart in a co-operative protocol?
This will serve the greater good.
Your proposal goes against our grain.
Join the Empire in a glorious co-operative protocol!
This will lead us to cover the stars with glory!
The Empire spurns your self-serving request.
Horatio does you the honor of offering a co-operative protocol.
We are pleased by this idea. Horatio accept.
The number of better things to do with our time is... Endless.
The Communion offers you a co-operative protocol.
This will aid our efforts. We accept.
Your offer does not interest us at this time.
This whole protocol thing isn't working so well. We're outta here.
Are you kidding? We were replacing all those neurons you lack.
What you offer does not sate us. This protocol is over.
You anger our drones. This is unwise.
The Church Virtual no longer finds your contributions to the protocol worthwhile.
The Church is surprised by your lack of fidelity.
There's not enough profit for us, and we don't do protocols for fun.
Apparently you don't need Dust! We can't imagine what that's like.
This co-operation protocol does not serve the needs of the Unfallen.
We are surprised and saddened by your rejection.
Your petty assistance is not enough to keep the Empire's interest in this protocol.
We are stunned that you would reject the Empire's generosity.
Sadly for you, Horatio no longer find this protocol attractive.
We are stunned. Apparently you do not appreciate... anything.
The needs of the Riftborn are complex, and this protocol no longer serves them.
Do not see us as insulted; more as surprised.
No way. We only blow stuff up for a good reason. We're outta this alliance.
Really? Not interested in some unbridled weapons testing?
Your taste for war is not the same as ours. Goodbye.
It is your choice to die when and where you wish.
The Church cannot tolerate your military excesses. We leave this alliance.
The faithful will survive without you.
You know that you can make more Dust in peacetime? This war is not interesting.
Your call. The Families will survive without you.
We oppose this war in principle and for its intentions. We leave this alliance.
Your path is yours to make; we accept your decision.
The Empire wants no part of your foolish war; we leave the alliance!
The Empire notes that you think you are too powerful to need an alliance.
This war unpleasantness is so unpleasant that we must leave the alliance.
Fine, if you wish. The average beauty of the alliance just increased.
Your war is meaningless and destructive. The Riftborn will leave the alliance.
The Riftborn understand that you wish to craft your own destiny.
Here's a little something from your friends in the Sophonity!
The Hive shares the bounty of its conquests with you.
This gift shows the esteem that the Church feels for you.
The Families agree that we should give you this gift.
The Heart feels you are kindred souls, and wishes for you to have this.
The Empire wishes to show that we value our relations.
Though you are not as wonderful as Horatio, we do appreciate you.
The Riftborn offer this gift, and hope for tangible or intangible recompense.
Thanks! That's the coolest thing we've seen since retrocausality!
Your gift will be consumed approriately.
The faithful acknowledge your generosity.
I speak for all the Families in thanking your for this gesture.
The Heart is glad to receive your gift.
The Empire appreciates those who appreciate the Empire!
Horatio is pleased that you apppreciate our beauty.
Your gift eases the burdon on the Continuum.

[TBD] Hero Sophons DLC Lore Description
[TBD] Hero Sophons DLC Content Description
Target Locked

Introduces major addition to space battles; Fighter and Bomber squadrons, new modules and new battle tactics. On top of that, a new quest and pirate hero are part of this update, as well as a whole new set of explosion special effects.
Little Grin Man
Adds a new Hero, their Minor Civilization, and an associated quest as a Halloween treat from Amplitude Studios.
Galactic Statecraft Update

The Galactic Statecraft Free Update offers the players plenty of new options to interact and collaborate with other major players, as well as a series of new features and game improvements. For those who favor the subtle art of negotiation rather than brutal bloodshed, the game now offers new diplomatic means for faction leaders to solve conflictual situations, making collaboration more rewarding and accessible than ever.

The Galactic Statecraft Free Update offers the players plenty of new options to interact and collaborate with other major players, as well as a series of new features and game improvements. For those who favor the subtle art of negotiation rather than brutal bloodshed, the game now offers new diplomatic means for faction leaders to solve conflictual situations, making collaboration more rewarding and accessible than ever.

IMPROVED ALLIANCES New options are now available when players make alliances with other factions. You can now react to your allies’ decisions, leave the alliance in case of a declared war, or strengthen your bond with your allies, allowing you to benefit from faction-specific bonuses.
COORDINATION TOOL Players can now ask their allies to attack or defend specific locations in the galaxy, by placing a marker directly in the galaxy view. This will improve communication among allies, as text can be added. Note that the AI will also use it and react to your indicators, making cooperation with AI allies a lot more rewarding! Time to work on that pincer maneuver…
PIRATE LAIRS Minor factions will now only create fleets to defend their systems, and their reaction to your fleet will depend on the locals’ inclination. Space scourge now come from pirate lairs, that can appear on nearby uninhabited systems. Attack & destroy these lairs to curb the pirate threat!
CONTEXTUAL DIPLOMACY Players and AI empires now have access to a tool to solve conflictual situations through diplomacy. Triggered by specific events (such as trespassing, nearby colonization, …), players will use diplomatic dialog over several turns, where both factions will have choices to make.
ACADEMY & THE HERETIC The stakes have been raised with the Heretic’s plot now having potentially dramatic consequences for the galaxy. Choose your side carefully…
HALL OF FAME Keep a trace of past victories and defeats via a local leaderboard, with filters and sorting options. Remember that time you tried Pacifist Cravers? Now you will!
WEAPONS RETAKE Weapon design has been deeply rethought, and a complete rebalancing was implemented between projectile & energy weapons. Projectiles weapons now have a high risk/high reward philosophy, while their energy counterparts deal more constant damage. Make sure to check your fleets before you head into battle!
PRESSURE RETAKE The pressure feature has been reworked, to offer a more transparent and clear interface, so players can better see how it is affecting their relationships with neighboring empires.
ORBITAL STATIONS Increasing your system level and your population will propel new space stations orbiting your colonized planets.
CONSTELLATION CONTROL The first player to control three systems on a constellation will “own” this constellation, granting specific resource bonuses and showing everyone who’s boss around here.
EVENTS A series of new events was implemented in the game to enrich the Endless Space 2 experience with more immersive art and story.
Congratulations! You’re playing with new Endless Space 2 content.

The Unfallen insist that you cease this "peaceful" theft of our systems.

We are imposing this policy; we know what's best!
Didn't your Mom teach you how to say "please"? Because you said, "impose"!
Our hives insist on imposing this policy.
It is not smart to enrage the Hive with this imposed policy.
Don't think of it as an imposition. More like a non-refusable offer.
You're imposing one bad deal after another.
Our holy cause requires that we impose this upon you.
The Church views you as an infidel for what you have imposed!
The Empire dictates its own policies, and imposes this one on you.
Wiser souls would ask the Empire before imposing things.
As part of our greater plan, we must impose this policy.
You are the galaxy's greatest creator of imposed ugliness.
The needs of the Continuum require us to impose this policy.
You should discuss it with us first, not simply impose.
Though it does not seem to be a harmonious action, we must impose this policy.
This imposition is a harmful way to do dialog.
Diplomatic Choices
Stop Peaceful Conversion and reset Pressure to 0
You have stolen a system and brainwashed its inhabitants. We're coming to get it back.
"Peace" does not include the theft of star systems. But it seems that war is what you prefer, so war is what you'll have.
Your fanaticism has driven you to mindless violence! If your religious fury drives you to war, we are ready.
Regardless of our diplomatic relations, you decided to steal a star system. That is an act of war, and we will treat it as such.
War declaration unavailable for ($(Duration)[turn])
You see where your fanaticism has led you? Mindless violence! Well, prepare for some mindful violence.
Huh--we thought that system you converted would be too strong-minded to fall for your cheap brainwashing tricks! Well, this means war!
Do you understand the concept of "peace"? It does not include the theft of star systems! But it seems that war is what you prefer, so war is what you'll have.

Regardless of our diplomatic relations, you decided to steal a star system. That is an act of war, and we will treat it as such. Perhaps you should invest in a dictionary and look up the word "alliance".
czztr--ggrrr--koltok . . . ADMIRING: You learn the power of fanaticism. Now we war.
bzzt--nntf--dhha . . . ANGRY: The Hive will tear that stolen system from your cold dead hands!
bhhii--lsh--wkar . . . ASHAMED: The Hive should never have forged a peace--or waited for your thievery to declare war.
kddok--vaarr--czzt . . . BLUNT: Alliances are for the craven. The Hive relishes a return to war.
Your fanaticism has led you into righteous war, but at what cost? Make no mistake, the Families will repay every attack with interest.
And the Families thought that system would be immune to a charlatan's tricks. Nevermind, we will take it back. We are at war.
When do we see the worst of species? In times of war--or peace? Both, it seems. Now watch us do our worst..
In business, we Lumerians have a saying: 'Always know who you're stealing from.' This alliance is over. Prepare for war.
There is a purity in the righteous fury of the fanatical, no? Does the strength of your faith match ours though? We will find out.
The Church deems the theft of a single soul on a single world a grave affront, so you can imagine what your theft of a whole system means. We are coming.
To smite an enemy is one thing; to strike against a peaceful friend is something else. Your theft of our system will be met with great wrath.
An alliance is not an invitation for such blasphemous treachery. The Church will show no leniency.
The Empire cares not whether your violence stems from the deepest fanaticism or enlightened thinking. We will crush you in either case.
When the Empire has reclaimed the system you have so brazenly stolen, I will personally oversee the punishment for their spineless capitulation. As for you, expect no mercy.
Mark my words, you will come to deeply regret this act of theft. We had a peace, but it is no more. Now it is war.
Maybe the Empire would have given you that system freely, a gift from one ally to another. Now we will never know. Ready your pitiful empire for war.
Isn't it tiring being at the mercy of fanatics? Horatio thinks--and is right, of course--that violent intentions should spring from cold reason not hot passions. So, war it is.
Horatio is somewhat aghast that your amateur hypnotics worked against his perfect specimens. Now I need to liberate them. Let us war.
Hmm, perhaps you are even stupider than I estimated. Empires at peace do not steal star systems from one another. War it is then!
Let me get this straight. We formed an alliance. Later you stole one of Horatio's systems. You display the intelligence of a cockroach--and like a cockroach you will be squashed.
Violence, whether wielded by fanatics or realists, is the last refuge of the desperate. With sadness, we will meet your violence with violence.
The Riftborn only feel sadness for the minds trapped in your lies. The system you have stolen and brainwashed will be freed. We are coming.
And we thought peace meant friendship, respect, support. Not theft. Every day in this universe we learn more. War, then.
This universe is ugly. An ally who steals star systems. Consider this alliance over, and a state of war initiated.
The Heart knows violence is never the answer, fanatical or not. We Unfallen will one day forgive you, but now we must wage war.
To deceive--and steal--an entire world is a great sin. The Heart has commanded us to reclaim what was ours--by whatever means necessary.
You have much to learn before you understand peace. The theft of our system has wounded the Heart, and retaliation is inevitable.
And so our alliance comes to an end and turns to war. Did you really think such a theft would go unnoticed or be acceptable? The Heart is peace-loving, but not foolish.
What gives?! We accepted your demands, yet you still declare war. The gloves are coming off!
"grrb--jaka--mwt . . . MENACING: The Hive should've ignored your demands. We live for war. "
The Families will long remember this duplicity. Let us have this war then!
Your declaration of war after our acceptance of your demands gravely insults the Church. Expect no mercy.
You made demands. We met those demands. Yet now you declare war. You are beneath even roaches. I spit on you, and your rotten empire.
War? You declare war on I, Horatio, the most perfect specimen in the galaxy, after Horatio ceded to your ugly demands? You rotter!
What a sad little universe this is. We met your demands, yet you repay us with a declaration of war. The Riftborn will not forget.
We met your demands, yet you declared war. We rail against your deceit, but the Heart still counsels peace. If we must wage war, let us make it brief.
